Package se.arkalix.plugin

Interface PluginAttached

  • public interface PluginAttached
    The part of a Plugin that concretely handles ArSystem life- cycle events.

    All methods specified in this interface, except for onDetach() and onDetach(Throwable), must be thread-safe.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      default java.util.Optional<PluginFacade> facade()
      Gets facade of attached plugin.
      default void onDetach()
      Invoked when this plugin is about to be detached from its ArSystem.
      default void onDetach​(java.lang.Throwable cause)
      Called to notify this plugin that it is about to be forcibly detached due to unexpectedly throwing an exception when one of its methods was called, or that onDetach() threw an exception.
      default void onServiceDismissed​(ServiceDescription service)
      Called to notify the plugin that a service currently provided by its ArSystem is about to be dismissed.
      default Future<?> onServicePrepared​(ArService service)
      Called to notify this plugin that a new service is prepared for being provided by its ArSystem.
      default Future<?> onServiceProvided​(ServiceDescription service)
      Called to notify the plugin that a new service is about to be provided by its ArSystem.
      default Future<java.util.Collection<ServiceDescription>> onServiceQueried​(ServiceQuery query)
      Called to notify the plugin that its ArSystem desires to resolve the service described by the provided query.

    • Method Detail

      • facade

        default java.util.Optional<PluginFacade> facade()
        Gets facade of attached plugin.

        A plugin facade is an arbitrary implementation of the PluginFacade interface that allows for other plugins attached to the same system to interact with this plugin. Care should be taken to make this method, if overridden, and the facade or facades it returns, thread-safe.

        Returns:
        Plugin facade, if any.

      • onDetach

        default void onDetach()
        Invoked when this plugin is about to be detached from its ArSystem. A detached plugin is not notified of system life-cycle events.

        This method is guaranteed to never be called more than once.

        If this method throws an exception, onDetach(Throwable) is invoked with that exception.

      • onDetach

        default void onDetach​(java.lang.Throwable cause)
        Called to notify this plugin that it is about to be forcibly detached due to unexpectedly throwing an exception when one of its methods was called, or that onDetach() threw an exception.

        If this method throws an exception it will not be called again.

        Parameters:
        cause - The exception causing the plugin to be detached.

      • onServicePrepared

        default Future<?> onServicePrepared​(ArService service)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Called to notify this plugin that a new service is prepared for being provided by its ArSystem.

        This method provides the only opportunity for this plugin to affect the internals of provided services. Note, however, that it being called does not guarantee that onServiceProvided(ServiceDescription) will be called for the same service, as when this method is invoked it has not yet been verified if the service has been configured correctly or if its configuration clashes with an existing service. This method must never assume that services it is given will be provided by its system.

        If this method throws an exception the returned Future is failed with the same exception. The plugin is not detached by uncaught exceptions.

        Parameters:
        service - The service being added.
        Returns:
        Future that must complete when this method is done modifying or reacting to the given service being provided. If the Future is completed with a fault, the service is never provided and the fault is relayed to the caller trying to cause the service to be provided.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • onServiceProvided

        default Future<?> onServiceProvided​(ServiceDescription service)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Called to notify the plugin that a new service is about to be provided by its ArSystem.

        By the time this method is called, it is known that the service in question will be, or already is, provided by this plugin's system. Furthermore, onServiceDismissed(ServiceDescription) is guaranteed to be called for every service this method is provided, given that the application is not shutdown abnormally.

        If this method throws an exception the returned Future is failed with the same exception. The plugin is not detached by uncaught exceptions.

        Parameters:
        service - A description of the service being added.
        Returns:
        Future that must complete when this method is done reacting to the given service being provided. If the Future is completed with a fault, the service is never provided and the fault is relayed to the caller trying to cause the service to be provided.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • onServiceDismissed

        default void onServiceDismissed​(ServiceDescription service)
        Called to notify the plugin that a service currently provided by its ArSystem is about to be dismissed.

        If this method throws an exception the plugin is detached and onDetach(Throwable) is invoked with the exception.

        Parameters:
        service - A description of the service being removed.

      • onServiceQueried

        default Future<java.util.Collection<ServiceDescription>> onServiceQueried​(ServiceQuery query)
                                                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Called to notify the plugin that its ArSystem desires to resolve the service described by the provided query.

        If this method throws an exception the returned Future is failed with the same exception. The plugin is not detached by uncaught exceptions.

        Parameters:
        query - An incomplete description of the service being queried.
        Returns:
        Future that will complete with a collection of service descriptions, out of which some may match the provided query.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
